text: Is it kosher to specify a symbolic link as the library product in a `build_tarballs.jl`? Microsoft's SEAL produces `libsealc.so.3.6.2` as a file and has `libsealc.so.3`, `libsealc.so.3.6` and `libsealc.so.3.6.2` point on it (or each other). I was thus wondering if it is ok to actually just name the symbolic link `libsealc.so` as the product, as otherwise the product needs to be changed with each new release (which wouldn't be such a huge issue either, I guess).
